cards.name: Disrupter
cards.text: [Trash]: Prevent a trace. That trace initiates again with a base trace strength of 0.
cards.flavor: "Saved my bacon more than once, but gives a wicked sense of deja vu." -Whizzard

cards.name: Force of Nature
cards.text: 2[Credits]: Break up to 2 code gate subroutines. 1[Credit]: +1 strength.

cards.name: Scrubber
cards.text:
2[Recurring Credits]
Use these credits to trash cards.
cards.flavor: "They're mindless tools of destruction, good for little else. Nice guys, though. Some of my best friends are scrubbers." -Ji "Noise" Reilly

cards.name: Doppelganger
cards.text: +1[Memory Unit] Once per turn, you may immediately make another run when a successful run ends. Limit 1 console per player.

cards.name: Crescentus
cards.text: [Trash]: Derez a piece of ice. Use this ability only after breaking all the subroutines of that ice during a single encounter.

cards.name: Deus X
cards.text: [Trash]: Break any number of AP subroutines. [Trash]: Prevent any amount of net damage.

cards.name: All-nighter
cards.text: [Click], [Trash]: Gain [Click][Click].
cards.flavor: "I don't care what the studies say. From my experience, I can ingest three cans of Diesel an hour for up to twelve hours before going into cardiac arrest." -heard during the eleventh hour

cards.name: Inside Man
cards.text:
2[Recurring Credits]
Use these credits to install hardware.
cards.flavor: Few corporate employees have such wide-sweeping security clearance as the janitorial staff. Most corps foolishly think they're too dim-witted to take advantage of it.

cards.name: Underworld Contact
cards.text: When your turn begins, gain 1[Credit] if you have at least 2[Link].
cards.flavor: "My boss rewards quality work. If you know what's good for you, you'll keep it up."

cards.name: Green Level Clearance
cards.text: Gain 3[Credits] and draw 1 card.
cards.flavor: Green-two clearance is the highest level of security a corp can gain access to. Legally, anyway.

cards.name: Hourglass
cards.text:
[Subroutine] The Runner loses [Click], if able.
[Subroutine] The Runner loses [Click], if able.
[Subroutine] The Runner loses [Click], if able.

cards.name: Dedicated Server
cards.text:
2[Recurring Credits]
Use these credits to rez ice.
cards.flavor: so very still, even cherry blossoms are not stirred by the temple bell -Fuhaku

cards.name: Bullfrog
cards.text: [Subroutine] You and the Runner secretly spend 0[Credits], 1[Credit], or 2[Credit]. Reveal spent credits. If you and the Runner spent a different number of credits, move Bullfrog so that it is the outermost piece of ice protecting another server (the Runner continues the run from this new position and is now running on this new server).

cards.name: Uroboros
cards.text: [Subroutine] Trace4- If successful, the Runner cannot make another run this turn. [Subroutine] Trace4- If successful, end the run.

cards.name: Net Police
cards.text:
X[Recurring Credits]
Use these credits during traces. X is the number of links the Runner has.
cards.flavor: This is the net. We work here. We're cops.

cards.name: Weyland Consortium: Because We Built It
cards.text:
1[Recurring Credit]
Use this credit to advance ice.

cards.name: Government Contracts
cards.text: [Click], [Click]: Gain 4[Credits].
cards.flavor: It's really hard to lose a government contract.

cards.name: Tyrant
cards.text: Tyrant can be advanced only while rezzed and gains "[Subroutine] End the run." for each advancement token on it.

cards.name: Oversight AI
cards.text: Rez a piece of ice, ignoring all costs, and install Oversight AI on that ice as a hosted condition counter with the text "Trash host ice if all its subroutines are broken during a single encounter."

cards.name: False Lead
cards.text: Forfeit False Lead: The Runner loses [Click][Click], if able.
cards.flavor: It didn't look like the headquarters of a multi-billion cred company. Probably because it wasn't.
